text: Pirate Submarine is a 1951 French film that was released in the US in 1952. It told the story of the submarine Casabianca in World War Two.Technicolor Adventures In Bagdad R. N. The Christian Science Monitor 6 Sep 1952: 13. Its original title was Casabianca. It was made in French and released in a dubbed English version.PIRATE SUBMARINE (Casabianca) Monthly Film Bulletin; London Vol. 21, Iss. 240, (Jan 1, 1954): 179. ==Cast== *Pierre Dudan as Sgt. Tony Luccioni *Gérard Landry as Lt. Delac *Jean Vilmont as Chief Engineer Marac *Alain Terrane as 'Mistral', tall sailor *Jean Vilar as Submarine Commandant Jean L'Herminier ==References== ==External links== * * Category:French films Category:1951 films Category:French war films Category:French-language films Category:World War II submarine films
title: Pirate Submarine
